Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge over 15% after big relief from Supreme Court - CNBCTV18
summary:
Delta Corp, Nazara Tech shares surge over 15% after big relief from Supreme Court

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Supreme Court provided relief to online gaming companies by staying GST show cause notices worth ₹1.12 lakh crore, resulting in a significant uptick in stock prices for Delta Corp and Nazara Tech.

  • Delta Corp shares surged by 14%, while Nazara Tech shares increased by 7% after the news broke.
  • The stock gains were fueled by concerns over possible coercive actions by tax authorities.
  • The court ruling has stayed all further proceedings under the challenged GST notices until a final decision is made.
  • The larger tax demand from the DGGI against 71 gaming companies could total ₹2.3 lakh crore including penalties.
  • Shares cooled off from initial highs, with Delta Corp trading 4.5% higher later in the day.
"The Supreme Court has directed that all further proceedings under the show cause notice will remain stayed till the case is finally decided."

The court's intervention indicates ongoing legal challenges within the gaming industry, highlighting the significance of regulatory clarity for market participants.
newTitle: Delta Corp and Nazara Tech Shares Surge After Supreme Court Relief

title: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Rise As TCS, Infosys Share Prices Lead; Nifty IT Surges 3% - NDTV Profit
summary:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As Surge In IT Stocks Offset Decline In Financials, Pharma, Energy

Date: Not specified, Source: NDTV Profit

Both the Nifty 50 and Sensex recovered from day's low to trade flat. A surge in IT stocks made up for losses in financials, pharma, and auto.

Key Highlights

  • Sensex and Nifty displayed flat trading.
  • Recovery aided by IT sector performance.
  • Financials, pharma, and auto sectors experienced declines.
  • Union Bank's shares hit a 52-week low.
  • Syrma SGS Technologies secured a deal to manufacture laptops for MSI.
"IT stocks are proving resilient amidst declines in other sectors."

The market's flat performance indicates a mixed sentiment, driven largely by the fluctuation in IT stocks countering losses in other industries.
newTitle: Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As IT Stocks Increase Despite Decline in Other Sectors

IREDA Q3FY25 net profit jumps 27% YoY to ₹425 crore; shares trade lower - Upstox
summary:
IREDA Q3FY25 net profit jumps 27% YoY to ₹425 crore; shares trade lower

Publication Date: N/A

Source: N/A

IREDA has reported a significant increase in net profit and revenue from operations for the third quarter of FY25, indicating strong growth in the renewable energy sector.

  • Revenue from operations rose 36% YoY to ₹1,698 crore.
  • Net profit jumped 27% YoY to ₹426 crore.
  • Non-fossil fuel capacity increased to 200 GW, aiming for 500 GW by 2030.
  • Operating income increased by 51% YoY to ₹652 crore.
  • GNPA improved to 2.68% from 2.90% YoY.
  • Loan book expanded to ₹68,960 crore from ₹50,580 crore YoY.
  • Shares recorded nearly 5% negative returns for Q3FY25, although they more than doubled in 2024.
"The renewable energy sector witnessed strong growth..."

The results reflect IREDA's strong performance amidst challenges in share prices, showcasing the resilience of the renewable energy sector.
newTitle: IREDA Reports 27% YoY Net Profit Increase for Q3FY25 Despite Share Decline

title: Adani Wilmar shares crash 9% as promoter looks to sell up to 20% stake via OFS - Moneycontrol
Adani Wilmar shares slide 9% as promoter looks to divest 20% stake via OFS | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Adani Wilmar Shares Drop 9% as Promoter Plans to Divest 20% Stake

Date: January 10, 2025 Source: Live Mint

Adani Wilmar's shares plummeted by 9.5% following the announcement of a plan by its promoter to divest up to 20% stake through an Offer For Sale (OFS).

  • The promoter, Adani Commodities LLP, will sell up to 17,54,56,612 equity shares, representing 13.5% of the company's total equity.
  • The OFS begins for non-retail investors on January 10 and for retail investors on January 13.
  • Adani Enterprises plans to exit its joint venture stake in Adani Wilmar, affecting the company's shareholding structure.
  • The company's revenue saw a 33% YoY increase in Q3 FY25, despite challenges in the market.
“The value of Adani Enterprises' current stake in Adani Wilmar is estimated at ₹18,500 crore, equivalent to over $2 billion.”

The stock's decline and the ongoing divestment plan highlight significant market shifts and challenges ahead for Adani Wilmar.
newTitle: Adani Wilmar Shares Drop 9% as Promoter Plans to Divest 20% Stake

title: TCS share price soars over 6% on robust Q3 results, $10.2 billion order book and dividend announcement - Upstox
summary:
TCS Shares Surge Over 6% Following Strong Q3 Results and Dividend Announcement

Published on: Not provided Source: Not provided

TCS share price experienced a significant increase after the announcement of its Q3 results and dividends, reflecting strong financial performance and a healthy order book.

  • TCS share price rose by 6.28% to ₹4,292.65 on the NSE.
  • The company's market capitalization is ₹15,48,830.90 crore.
  • Q3 net profit reached ₹12,380 crore, an increase of 11.95% YoY.
  • Revenue from operations was ₹63,973 crore, a 5.59% increase YoY.
  • New order bookings amounted to USD 10.2 billion.
  • The company announced a dividend of ₹76 per equity share.
"We are pleased with the excellent TCV performance in Q3 which was well-rounded across industries, geographies and service lines lending good visibility to long-term growth," K Krithivasan, CEO of TCS.

The IT services sector is showing signs of recovery, with positive indications in various verticals, and TCS's strong performance contributes to a favorable outlook.
newTitle: TCS Shares Surge Over 6% Following Strong Q3 Results and Dividend Announcement

title: TCS share price soars over 4% on robust Q3 results, $10.2 billion order book and dividend announcement - Upstox
summary:
TCS Shares Surge Over 4% Following Strong Q3 Results and Dividend Announcement

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Not specified

Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) shares saw a significant increase of over 4% after announcing its Q3 results along with a dividend declaration.

The key highlights from the article are as follows:

  • TCS share price increased by 4.6% to ₹4,225 on the NSE.
  • Consolidated post-tax profit reached ₹12,380 crore, marking an 11.95% increase YoY.
  • Revenue from operations was ₹63,973 crore, a 5.59% rise YoY.
  • New order bookings hit USD 10.2 billion, up significantly from USD 7.9 billion last year.
  • A dividend of ₹76 per equity share was declared.
  • CEO K Krithivasan expressed confidence in future growth despite market challenges.
  • TCS workforce decreased by over 5,000 employees, with an attrition rate of 13%.
“We are pleased with the excellent TCV performance in Q3... give us confidence for the future,” - K Krithivasan, CEO TCS

This strong performance and positive outlook underscore TCS's resilience and growth potential in the IT services sector.
newTitle: TCS Shares Surge Over 4% Following Strong Q3 Results and Dividend Announcement

Reliance Industries share selling is 'overdone', says Goldman Sachs, sees 27% upside - CNBCTV18
summary:
Reliance Industries share selling is 'overdone', says Goldman Sachs, sees 27% upside

Published on: Jan 10, 2025 9:03 AM IST
Source: CNBCTV18

Goldman Sachs views the recent selling of Reliance Industries shares as excessive, projecting a potential upside of 26% from current levels.

  • Goldman Sachs maintains a 'buy' rating with a price target of ₹1,595.
  • The brokerage forecasts a 24% growth in Reliance Industries' EBITDA for financial year 2026.
  • They anticipate factors such as a rebound in refining margins and a telecom tariff hike to drive growth.
  • However, they have revised EBITDA estimates downwards for financial years 2025, 2026, and 2027.
  • Key risks include lower refining and chemical margins, decreased market share in retail, and project delays.
  • Of 39 analysts covering the stock, 33 have a 'buy' rating.
  • Reliance Industries will announce its September quarter results on January 16.
Goldman Sachs believes that the selling seen in shares of Reliance Industries Ltd. is "overdone" and that the share price is now near their "bear case" scenario.

This analysis highlights the potential for recovery in Reliance Industries stock amid varying risks and market expectations.
newTitle: Reliance Industries share selling is 'overdone', says Goldman Sachs, sees 27% upside

title: Tata Elxsi shares fall 8% after Street expects shares to continue underperforming - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tata Elxsi Shares Drop 8% Amid Analyst Downgrades

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Tata Elxsi Ltd. shares fell by 8% following disappointing quarterly results and price target reductions from analysts.

  • Shares dropped due to price target cuts after underwhelming December quarter results.
  • Net profit decreased by 13% QoQ, totaling ₹199 crore.
  • Revenue dipped 1.7% QoQ to ₹939 crore, with a notable decline in the media and communications unit.
  • Morgan Stanley downgraded the stock to 'Underperform' and lowered the price target to ₹6,000.
  • Only 3 out of 14 analysts rated the stock as a 'Buy', while 11 issued 'Sell' ratings.
Morgan Stanley noted, "Weakness in European transportation continues, and a significant recovery in media and healthcare remains elusive."

The significant drop in Tata Elxsi's stock price, alongside analysts' cautious outlook, raises concerns over its future performance.
newTitle: Tata Elxsi Shares Drop 8% Amid Analyst Downgrades

summary:
Q3 Earnings Reports: Just Dial, PCBL, GNA Axles, and Others to Announce Results on January 10

On January 10, 2025, 15 companies will announce their Q3 financial results, including notable firms such as Just Dial, PCBL, and GNA Axles. This announcement follows Tata Consultancy Services’ impressive earnings from the previous day.

Key Points:

  • Leading companies like Just Dial, PCBL, GNA Axles, and Equinox India Developments are set to report.

This upcoming earnings report day is highly anticipated as companies are expected to reflect the ongoing economic trends and their performance amidst changing market conditions.

title: Stock Market LIVE: Benchmarks turn green; Sensex climbs 150 pts to 77,750; Nifty at 23,550; IT up 3% - Business Standard
summary:
Stock Market LIVE Updates: Sensex flat at 77,630; Nifty at 23,500; IT up 3%; Broader mkts decline

Date: January 10, 2025, Source: Business Standard

Indian benchmark equity indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 experienced a decline on January 10, 2025, amidst global market uncertainties.

  • The BSE Sensex was down by 133.54 points, trading at 77,486.67.
  • The Nifty50 dropped by 64.70 points, settling at 23,461.80.
  • Only seven stocks on the Sensex gained while others, including TCS and Tech Mahindra, saw losses.
  • Sector-wise, the IT index positively performed with a 2% increase, while most other sectors declined around 1%.
  • The Indian economy is projected to grow by 6.6% in 2025, as reported by the UN.
  • Foreign institutional investors sold Indian equities worth ₹7,170.87 crores, while domestic investors bought equities worth ₹7,639.63 crores.
“The excess earnings of unlisted companies are at a record level, the highest interest-coverage ratio since 1990-91.”

The Indian stock market faces challenges due to international trends and ongoing selling by foreign institutional investors.
newTitle: Stock Market Update: Sensex and Nifty Trade Lower Amid Global Uncertainty

title: Fastest growing and declining job roles by 2030 as per WEF, all you need to know - Hindustan Times
summary:
Fastest Growing and Declining Job Roles by 2030 as per WEF

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The World Economic Forum (WEF) predicts significant changes in job roles by 2030, highlighting both job growth and declines across various sectors.

  • 170 million new jobs will be created, while 92 million will be displaced, resulting in a net increase of 78 million jobs.
  • Big data specialists, FinTech engineers, and AI & machine learning specialists are among the top 3 fastest growing job roles.
  • Postal service clerks, bank tellers, and data entry clerks are projected to be the top 3 declining job roles.
  • Technological advancements and digital access are key drivers of growth in job roles.
  • Farmworkers are expected to see a significant increase of 35 million jobs by 2030 due to green transition trends.
“Farmworkers top the list of the largest growing job roles in the next five years and are expected to see 35 million more jobs by 2030.”

This report serves as a crucial insight into the evolving landscape of employment opportunities and challenges, urging individuals and organizations to prepare for these changes.
newTitle: Fastest Growing and Declining Job Roles by 2030 According to WEF

title: L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan paid ₹51 crore as salary in FY24, while median salary of employees was… - Hindustan Times
summary:
L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's ₹51 Crore Salary Sparks Outrage

Published on: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: The New Indian Express

Larsen & Toubro chairman SN Subrahmanyan earned a total salary of ₹51 crore in FY24, which is 534.57 times the median salary of employees at the company.

  • Subrahmanyan's remuneration included a base salary of ₹3.6 crore, ₹1.67 crore in prerequisites, and ₹35.28 crore in commission.
  • His retirement benefits totaled ₹10.5 crore.
  • He is facing backlash for suggesting employees work 90 hours a week.
  • His comments have been criticized by celebrities and social media users, highlighting the disparity between his salary and that of average employees.
  • The median salary for L&T employees was ₹9.55 lakh in FY24, compared to Subrahmanyan's ₹51 crore.
  • His salary increased by 43.11% from the previous year.
  • L&T defended his remarks by stating that extraordinary outcomes require extraordinary efforts.
“If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays.” - SN Subrahmanyan

The salary disparity and Subrahmanyan's remarks raise significant questions about work-life balance and corporate culture at L&T.
newTitle: L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's ₹51 Crore Salary Sparks Outrage

title: Mahindra XEV 9e And BE 6 Top-end Pack 3 Variant To Be Available With A Much More Affordable Price Tag - CarDekho
summary:
Mahindra XEV 9e And BE 6 Top-end Pack 3 Variant To Be Available With Smaller 59 kWh Battery Pack Too

Date: Recent Announcement

Source: CarDekho.com

The recent announcement by Mahindra reveals that the top-end variants of their BE 6 and XEV 9e electric vehicles will now also offer a more affordable 59 kWh battery pack, alongside the existing 79 kWh options.

  • The BE 6 and XEV 9e are the first products under Mahindra’s new ‘BE’ and ‘XEV’ sub-brands for electric vehicles.
  • Both models will feature battery pack options of 59 kWh and 79 kWh, boasting a maximum claimed range of over 600 km.
  • Shared features include multi-zone AC, panoramic sunroof, and Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS).
  • The current pricing for the top-end BE 6 and XEV 9e is Rs 26.9 lakh and Rs 30.5 lakh (ex-showroom), respectively.
“Mahindra has confirmed that the top-end variant of both electric offerings will be available with the smaller 59 kWh battery pack as well.”

As electric vehicles gain popularity, the introduction of a more affordable battery option is expected to attract a broader range of consumers, enhancing market accessibility for Mahindra's EV lineup.
newTitle: Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6 to Offer Affordable 59 kWh Battery Options
